actions.committee: House Committee on Agriculture Sequentially, for a Period Ending not Later than 2 p
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture Sequentially, for a Period Ending not Later than 2 p.m., Aug 1, 83.
Passed House (Amended) by Yea-Nay Vote: 406 - 18 (Record Vote No: 303).
Senate disagreed to House amendments, requested a conference and appointed conferees. McClure; Wallop; Hatfield; Johnston; Bumpers.
House Insisted on its Amendments by Unanimous Consent.
House Agreed to Request for Conference and Speaker Appointed Conferees: Udall, Seiberling, Weaver, Huckaby, Whitley, Volkmer, Young (AK), Marlenee, Emerson.
Conferees agreed to file conference report.
Conference Report 98-663 Filed in House.
House Agreed to Conference Report by Yea-Nay Vote: 254 - 142 (Record Vote No: 127).
Senate agreed to conference report by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 98-289.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands and National Parks

official_title: A bill to establish the Irish Wilderness in Mark Twain National Forest, Missouri.

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 98-663) Irish Wilderness Act of 1983 - Designates the Irish Wilderness in the Mark Twain National Forest in Missouri as a component of the National Wilderness Preservation System. Repeals the prohibition under the 1984 Department of Interior Appropriation Act on the issuance of prospecting permits within the boundaries of the Irish Wilderness as proposed on the December 1981 map of such lands.

titles.title: A bill to establish the Irish Wilderness in Mark Twain National Forest, Missouri.
